results.title: The Tiny terrors
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: They are out for your blood and they will probably get it, but fighting a rear-guard action on your behalf is the scientist discovering new ways to combat the menace of the biting fly. In government and university entomology laboratories, a full-scale study of insect behavior and methods of mosquito larvae control is under way.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 5 and 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Caleb Deschanel, Lesli Glatter, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE FIVE: In this episode, Agent Cooper and Sheriff Truman discover several new leads which point to the involvement of Leo Johnson and Jacques Renault in Laura’s murder. Audrey Horne continues to provide more unexpected assistance to the investigation as she infiltrates the nearby brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, in an effort to impress Agent Cooper. Meanwhile, Donna forms a new bond with James Hurley and Madeline, while Laura’s father, Leland Palmer, becomes even more unhinged. EPISODE SIX: Agent Cooper and Big Ed Hurley, James’ uncle, go undercover at the casino and brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, unaware of Audrey’s similar plans. Meanwhile James Hurley and Donna Hayward, suspicious of Laura’s psychiatrist, Dr. Jacoby, decide to lay a trap for him by disguising Madeline as Laura, back from the dead. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Ep. 7. Bonus features [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Frost, Gregg Fienberg and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE SEVEN: The final episode of the first season sees the climax of several important plotlines. Donna and James’ trap for Dr. Jacoby backfires after he is beaten and has a heart attack. Agent Cooper’s undercover infiltration of One-Eyed Jacks leads to a telling encounter with Jacques Renault, who confesses to his activities on the night of Laura’s murder. Meanwhile, Leo Johnson sets fire to the mill with his wife inside, unknowing of the plans for his own demise. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: The Tin soldier. The Nightingale
results.creator_credit: Chris Schouten, Richard Morrison, W. H. Stevens, Wang Bairong, Atkinson Film Arts, Crawleys Animation and Shanghai Animation Films
results.brief_description: Two delightful animated children’s stories from the classic Hans Christian Anderson fairy tales, narrated by Christopher Plummer. “The Tin Soldier” is about friendship and love between a music box ballerina and a tin toy soldier. “The Nightingale” is an enchanting tale set in the mystical land of ancient China.

results.title: Vintage: A History of Wine. Eps. 11-13
results.creator_credit: Christopher Ralling, Michael Gill, Channel 4, Malone Gill Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: The migrating vine describes how the production of wine was taken south of the equator to South Africa by the Dutch and then to Australia which has developed into the France of the southern hemisphere in terms of wine production. “The grape goes west” details the history of wine production in California from the Franciscan monks of the seventeenth century to the days of Prohibition. ‘Vin Nouveau” looks at how technology and marketing techniques are influencing what we drink and expanding the climatic limits to the cultivation of the vine.

results.title: Vincent
results.brief_description: Vincent Van Gogh died, a pauper, on 29 July 1880 at the age of 37. In less than ten years he had produced some 1,800 works, only one of which had been sold. This film is a meditation on the actual paintings and drawings of Van Gogh, and the influences upon him. The script is made up entirely of letters the artist wrote over 18 years to his beloved brother Theo and these are read by British actor, John Hurt.

results.title: Westray
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Kent Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A moving account of the Westray coal mine disaster, which killed 26 men in Nova Scotia on May 9, 1992. Personal stories are brought to the screen in an innovative and dramatic style, tracing the stories of six people - three miners and three widows - whose lives were forever changed that day by a company that violated the most basic rules of mining safety. The film recreates the events that drew the workers to the high-tech mine, detailing the horror of the explosion and its complex and tragic aftermath. ‘Westray’ is a compelling portrait of working men and their wives that extends far beyond this particular mining disaster to highlight how the lives of working class people are often entrusted to companies that violate the most fundamental rules of safety and decency in the name of profit.

results.title: Villages of the lake district
results.brief_description: This documentary style production seeks out the fascinating history lying in the many villages tucked away within the district. Join W. R. Mitchell M.B.E. as he visits lakes around the villages of Rydal, Grasmere, Wasdale, Grange in Borrowdale, Troutbeck, Hartsop, Askham, Dacre, Hawkshead, Sawrey and many others. Take in the splendour of village life and the breathtaking scenery.

results.title: Village of idiots
results.creator_credit: Eugene Fedorenko, Rose Newlove, David Verrall, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Based on a Jewish folk tale, this animated short tells the story of a Shmendrik, a lovable fool who leaves his village on a circuitous quest for knowledge. The story of Shmendrik’s new life and its uncanny closeness to his old life offers a humorous take on people’s tendency to romanticize what they don’t have. Co-directors Fedorenko and Newlove filmed paper cut-outs on layers of glass to achieve unique, textured visuals.

results.title: Western wheat
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows the drama of the wheat harvest played out on millions of western Canadian acres. In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Gosnell, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
